diseases.name: Myocardial Infarction
diseases.description: A condition characterized by the death of heart muscle due to lack of blood supply.
symptoms: Severe retrosternal chest pain that can radiate to neck, jaw, epigastrium or left arm
Dyspnea due to impaired contraction of the ischemic myocardium and resultant pulmonary edema
diagnosis: Electrocardiographic changes (e.g., inverted T waves, elevated ST segments, Q waves)
Laboratory findings (e.g., elevated serum CK-MB and cardiac troponins)
treatment: Reperfusion by thrombolytic drugs, angioplasty/stent placement, or coronary artery bypass graft (CABG) surgery
complications: Left ventricular failure and cardiogenic shock

morphological_changes.light_microscopic_changes: None (electron microscope: relaxation of myofibrils; loss of glycogen and swelling of mitochondria)
Usually no changes but may show waviness of fibers at border (electron microscopy: mitochondrial amorphous densities)
Coagulative necrosis; pyknotic nuclei; increased eosinophilia of cytoplasm; contraction band necrosis at margins; beginning of neutrophilic infiltrate
Coagulation necrosis, loss of nuclei and striations; increased interstitial infiltration of neutrophils
Disintegration of dead myocardial cells, with disintegrating neutrophils; phagocytosis of dead cells by macrophages at the border of infarct
Phagocytosis of dead cells; formation of granulation tissue at margins
Well-established granulation tissue and collagen deposition

morphological_changes.gross_changes: Gray-white scar, progressive from border toward the center of the infarct
morphological_changes.light_microscopic_changes: Increased collagen deposition and decreased cellularity

diseases.name: Infective Endocarditis
diseases.description: An infection, usually bacterial, of the endocardium of heart valves or the mural endocardium.
causative_organisms: HACEK group (Haemophilus, Actinobacillus, Cardiobacterium, Eikenella, and Kingella)
symptoms: Clinical features of acute infection or complications depending on the type of endocarditis
diagnosis: Echocardiographic identification of a valve-related or implant-related mass or abscess
treatment: Antibiotics based on the identified organism
complications: Immunological phenomena (e.g., focal segmental glomerulonephritis, Osler nodes, Roth spots)

features: Caused by highly virulent organisms (e.g., Staphylococcus aureus, S. pyogenes)
Death within 6 weeks in many patients due to complications like acute heart failure or overwhelming sepsis
Involves structurally abnormal/deformed valves (e.g., rheumatic heart disease or congenital heart disease)
Caused by organisms of lower virulence (e.g., Streptococcus viridans, Staphylococcus epidermidis)
Protracted course of weeks to months

diseases.name: Rheumatic Fever
diseases.description: An acute, post-streptococcal, immune-mediated, multisystem inflammatory disease.
symptoms: Carditis (e.g., pericardial friction rubs, weak heart sounds, tachycardia, arrhythmias, murmurs)
diagnosis: Jones criteria (presence of two major criteria or one major and two minor criteria)
Antibodies to streptococcal enzymes (e.g., ASO, DNase B, antihyaluronidase)

diseases.name: Rheumatic Heart Disease
diseases.description: A post-streptococcal disease in which antistreptococcal antibodies cross-react with cardiac tissues.
symptoms: Dyspnea and hemoptysis with rust-colored sputum (heart failure cells)
diagnosis: Clinical findings (e.g., murmurs, signs of heart failure)
treatment: Medications for heart failure and arrhythmias
Surgical repair or prosthetic replacement of diseased valves

diseases.name: Congenital Heart Disease
diseases.description: Abnormalities of the heart or great vessels that are present from birth.
symptoms: Depends on the specific defect and its severity

diseases.name: Cardiomyopathy
diseases.description: A group of diseases of the myocardium that affect the mechanical or electrical function of the heart.
symptoms: Depends on the type and severity

diseases.name: Cardiac Myxoma
diseases.description: A benign tumor arising from primitive multipotent mesenchymal cells, most commonly found in the left atrium.
symptoms: Depends on the size and location of the tumor
May include valvular obstruction, embolization, or constitutional symptoms

diseases.name: Emphysema
diseases.description: A chronic obstructive airway disease characterized by permanent dilatation of air spaces distal to terminal bronchioles.

diseases.name: Chronic Bronchitis
diseases.description: A chronic inflammatory disease of the airways characterized by persistent cough with sputum production.

diseases.name: Asthma
diseases.description: A chronic inflammatory disorder of the bronchial tree characterized by reversible bronchoconstriction in response to various stimuli.

diseases.name: Bronchiectasis
diseases.description: A disorder characterized by irreversible, abnormal dilation of bronchi and bronchioles.

diseases.name: Pneumonia
diseases.description: An infection of the lung parenchyma that can be caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi.

diseases.name: Pneumocystis Pneumonia
diseases.description: An opportunistic fungal infection of the lungs by Pneumocystis jirovecii, commonly affecting immunocompromised individuals.
diagnosis: Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) for Pneumocystis jirovecii

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.description: A communicable, chronic granulomatous disease caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
diagnosis: Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) for Mycobacterium tuberculosis
treatment: Antituberculous therapy (e.g., isoniazid, rifampin, ethambutol, pyrazinamide)

diseases.name: Sarcoidosis
diseases.description: A multisystem disease of unknown cause characterized by the presence of noncaseating granulomas in many tissues and organs.

diseases.name: Acute Lung Injury and Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)
diseases.description: A condition characterized by inflammation, increased pulmonary vascular permeability, edema, and death of epithelial cells.

diseases.name: Atelectasis
diseases.description: A condition characterized by incomplete expansion of the lungs or collapse of previously expanded lung.
symptoms: Depends on the extent and type of atelectasis

diseases.name: Pneumoconioses
diseases.description: Lung diseases produced by organic as well as inorganic particulates and chemical fumes and vapors.
symptoms: Depends on the type and severity of pneumoconiosis

diseases.name: Lung Carcinomas
diseases.description: Malignant tumors arising from the lung tissue, commonly associated with smoking.

diseases.name: Atherosclerosis
diseases.description: A disease of the aorta and large arteries characterized by the presence of atherosclerotic plaques composed of smooth muscle cells and macrophages within the intima filled with lipid vacuoles.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., angiography, CT scan, MRI)
treatment: Lifestyle changes (e.g., diet, exercise, smoking cessation)
Surgical procedures (e.g., angioplasty, stenting, bypass surgery)

diseases.name: Alzheimer's Disease
diseases.description: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder that affects memory and cognitive function.

diseases.name: Diabetes Mellitus
diseases.description: A metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels due to insufficient insulin production or insulin resistance.
diagnosis: Blood sugar tests (e.g., fasting blood sugar, oral glucose tolerance test)

diseases.name: Cancer
diseases.description: A group of diseases characterized by abnormal cell growth that can invade or spread to other parts of the body.
symptoms: Changes in bowel or bladder habits
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, MRI, PET scan)

diseases.name: Cirrhosis
diseases.description: A late-stage scarring (fibrosis) of the liver caused by many forms of liver diseases and conditions, such as hepatitis and chronic alcoholism.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)
treatment: Treatment of underlying cause (e.g., antiviral medications for hepatitis)

diseases.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
diseases.description: A progressive lung disease that makes it hard to breathe.
complications: High blood pressure in lung arteries

diseases.name: Acute Pancreatitis
diseases.description: Sudden inflammation of the pancreas that can range from mild discomfort to a severe, life-threatening illness.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease in which the body's immune system mistakenly attacks healthy tissue.
treatment: Medications (e.g., anti-inflammatory drugs, corticosteroids, antimalarials, immunosuppressants)

diseases.name: Hemophilia
diseases.description: An inherited bleeding disorder in which the blood does not clot normally.
symptoms: Bleeding into the skin or mucous membranes

diseases.name: Leukemia
diseases.description: A type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow, characterized by the rapid production of abnormal white blood cells.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Osteoarthritis
diseases.description: A degenerative joint disease that occurs when the cartilage in the joints breaks down.

diseases.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease that causes chronic inflammation of the joints and other areas of the body.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., rheumatoid factor, anti-CCP antibody)

diseases.name: Gout
diseases.description: A type of inflammatory arthritis that develops in some people who have high levels of uric acid in the body.
treatment: Medications (e.g., NSAIDs, colchicine, corticosteroids, urate-lowering drugs)
complications: Tophi (urate crystals in joints, skin, and organs)

diseases.name: Alcoholic Liver Disease
diseases.description: Liver damage caused by excessive alcohol consumption.
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice)
Swelling in the legs and abdomen
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Hepatitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the liver caused by viral infections or other factors.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., liver function tests, viral hepatitis panel)
Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
diseases.description: A group of disorders in which the intestines become inflamed, including Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.

diseases.name: Acute Kidney Injury
diseases.description: A sudden episode of kidney failure or kidney damage that happens within a few hours or a few days.
symptoms: Swelling in legs, ankles, or around the eyes

diseases.name: Hypertension
diseases.description: A condition in which the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated.
treatment: Lifestyle changes (e.g., diet, exercise, weight loss, smoking cessation)
Medications (e.g., diuretics, ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers)
complications: Weakened and narrowed blood vessels in the kidneys
Thickened, narrowed, or torn blood vessels in the eyes

diseases.name: Stroke
diseases.description: A medical condition in which poor blood flow to the brain results in cell death.
symptoms: Sudden numbness or weakness of the face, arm, or leg, especially on one side of the body
Sudden trouble seeing in one or both eyes
treatment: Medications (e.g., tissue plasminogen activator, antiplatelets, anticoagulants)

diseases.name: Hypersensitivity Reactions
diseases.description: An exaggerated response of the immune system to a substance.

diseases.name: Autoimmune Diseases
diseases.description: Conditions in which the immune system mistakenly attacks healthy cells.

diseases.name: Obesity
diseases.description: A medical condition that occurs when a person carries excess weight or body fat that might affect their health.
symptoms: Inability to cope with sudden physical activity
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., lipid profile, blood sugar)

diseases.name: Anemia
diseases.description: A condition in which the body does not have enough healthy red blood cells to carry adequate oxygen to the body's tissues.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., iron levels, vitamin B12 levels, folate levels)
complications: Delayed growth and development in children

diseases.name: Thalassemia
diseases.description: A group of inherited blood disorders that affect the body's ability to produce hemoglobin and red blood cells.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, hemoglobin electrophoresis)

diseases.name: Sickle Cell Disease
diseases.description: A group of inherited red blood cell disorders that affects hemoglobin, the molecule in red blood cells that delivers oxygen to cells throughout the body.

diseases.name: Hemolytic Anemia
diseases.description: A condition in which red blood cells are destroyed and removed from the bloodstream before their normal lifespan is over.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, reticulocyte count, bilirubin levels)

diseases.name: Lymphoma
diseases.description: A group of blood cancers that develop from lymphocytes, a type of white blood cell.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, PET scan)

diseases.name: Multiple Myeloma
diseases.description: A cancer of plasma cells, a type of white blood cell normally responsible for producing antibodies.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, serum protein electrophoresis)

diseases.name: Hodgkin Lymphoma
diseases.description: A type of lymphoma, a cancer originating from white blood cells called lymphocytes.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, PET scan)

diseases.name: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
diseases.description: A diverse group of blood cancers that include any kind of lymphoma except Hodgkin lymphomas.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, PET scan)

diseases.name: Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia
diseases.description: A type of cancer that starts in the blood-forming cells of the bone marrow and invades the blood.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
diseases.description: A type of cancer that starts in the white blood cells (lymphocytes) in the bone marrow and invades the blood.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Hairy Cell Leukemia
diseases.description: A rare, slow-growing cancer in which the bone marrow makes too many lymphocytes.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Plasma Cell Neoplasms
diseases.description: A group of diseases in which the body makes too many plasma cells.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, serum protein electrophoresis)

diseases.name: Acute Leukemia
diseases.description: A type of cancer that affects the blood and bone marrow, characterized by the rapid production of abnormal white blood cells.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Myelodysplastic Syndromes
diseases.description: A group of disorders caused by poorly formed or dysfunctional blood cells.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Myeloproliferative Neoplasms
diseases.description: A group of disorders in which the bone marrow makes too many red blood cells, white blood cells, or platelets.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Polycythemia Vera
diseases.description: A rare blood disorder in which the bone marrow makes too many red blood cells.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Essential Thrombocythemia
diseases.description: A rare blood disorder in which the bone marrow makes too many platelets.
symptoms: Numbness or tingling in the hands or feet
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Primary Myelofibrosis
diseases.description: A rare blood disorder in which the bone marrow is replaced by scar tissue.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, peripheral blood smear)

diseases.name: Von Willebrand Disease
diseases.description: An inherited bleeding disorder caused by a deficiency or dysfunction of von Willebrand factor.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., von Willebrand factor levels, ristocetin cofactor activity)

diseases.name: Disseminated Intravascular Coagulation (DIC)
diseases.description: A condition in which blood clots form throughout the body, blocking small blood vessels.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, coagulation tests, fibrin degradation products)

diseases.name: Thrombocytopenia
diseases.description: A condition in which the blood has a lower than normal number of platelets.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., complete blood count, platelet count)

diseases.name: Hemophilia A
diseases.description: An inherited bleeding disorder caused by a deficiency of factor VIII.
symptoms: Bleeding into the skin or mucous membranes

diseases.name: Hemophilia B
diseases.description: An inherited bleeding disorder caused by a deficiency of factor IX.
symptoms: Bleeding into the skin or mucous membranes

diseases.name: Viral Hepatitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the liver caused by a viral infection.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., liver function tests, viral hepatitis panel)
Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Alcoholic Hepatitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the liver caused by excessive alcohol consumption.
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice)
Swelling in the legs and abdomen
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Autoimmune Hepatitis
diseases.description: A chronic disease in which the body's immune system attacks the liver.
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice)
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., liver function tests, autoantibodies)
Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Wilson's Disease
diseases.description: A genetic disorder that prevents the body from removing extra copper, leading to its accumulation in the liver and brain.
symptoms: Kayser-Fleischer rings (golden-brown discoloration of the eyes)
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., ceruloplasmin levels, copper levels)

diseases.name: Hemochromatosis
diseases.description: A condition in which the body absorbs too much iron, leading to its accumulation in various organs.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., iron levels, ferritin levels, transferrin saturation)

diseases.name: Primary Biliary Cholangitis
diseases.description: A chronic liver disease that slowly destroys the bile ducts in the liver.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., liver function tests, antimitochondrial antibodies)
Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis
diseases.description: A chronic liver disease that causes inflammation and scarring of the bile ducts.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI, ERCP)

diseases.name: Gallstones (Cholelithiasis)
diseases.description: Solid deposits that form in the gallbladder.
symptoms: Pain in the upper right abdomen
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Cholecystitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the gallbladder.
symptoms: Pain in the upper right abdomen
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Pancreatitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the pancreas.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Type 1 Diabetes
diseases.description: A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin.
diagnosis: Blood sugar tests (e.g., fasting blood sugar, oral glucose tolerance test)

diseases.name: Type 2 Diabetes
diseases.description: A chronic condition characterized by high blood sugar levels due to insulin resistance.
symptoms: Tingling or numbness in hands or feet
diagnosis: Blood sugar tests (e.g., fasting blood sugar, oral glucose tolerance test)

diseases.name: Gestational Diabetes
diseases.description: A type of diabetes that develops during pregnancy.

diseases.name: Crohn's Disease
diseases.description: A type of inflammatory bowel disease that can affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract.

diseases.name: Ulcerative Colitis
diseases.description: A type of inflammatory bowel disease that affects the lining of the rectum and colon.

diseases.name: Celiac Disease
diseases.description: An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.

diseases.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
diseases.description: A common disorder that affects the large intestine, causing abdominal pain, bloating, and changes in bowel habits.

diseases.name: Diverticulitis
diseases.description: Inflammation or infection of small pouches called diverticula that can form in the walls of the digestive system.

diseases.name: Appendicitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the appendix, a small tube connected to the large intestine.

diseases.name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
diseases.description: A condition in which painful sores or ulcers develop in the lining of the stomach or duodenum.
treatment: Medications (e.g., proton pump inhibitors, H2 blockers, antibiotics)

diseases.name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
diseases.description: A digestive disorder that occurs when stomach acid flows back into the esophagus.
treatment: Medications (e.g., proton pump inhibitors, H2 blockers, antacids)

diseases.name: Gastritis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the lining of the stomach.
treatment: Medications (e.g., proton pump inhibitors, H2 blockers, antibiotics)

diseases.name: Esophageal Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells that line the esophagus.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, PET scan)

diseases.name: Gastric Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells that line the stomach.

diseases.name: Colorectal Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells that line the colon or rectum.

diseases.name: Hepatocellular Carcinoma
diseases.description: The most common type of primary liver cancer.
symptoms: Yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice)
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., alpha-fetoprotein, liver function tests)
Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Pancreatic Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells of the pancreas.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, MRI, endoscopic ultrasound)

diseases.name: Breast Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that forms in the cells of the breast.
symptoms: Lump or thickening in the breast
Change in the size or shape of the breast

diseases.name: Cervical Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells lining the cervix.

diseases.name: Ovarian Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells of the ovaries.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Endometrial Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells lining the uterus.

diseases.name: Prostate Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells of the prostate gland.

diseases.name: Testicular Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells of the testicles.
symptoms: Lump or swelling in the testicle
Pain or discomfort in the testicle or scrotum
Sudden collection of fluid in the scrotum

diseases.name: Bladder Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells lining the bladder.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, MRI, cystoscopy)

diseases.name: Kidney Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells of the kidneys.
symptoms: Pain in the side or back
Lump or mass in the side or abdomen
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, MRI, ultrasound)

diseases.name: Thyroid Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells of the thyroid gland.
symptoms: Lump or swelling in the neck
Pain in the neck or throat
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., ultrasound, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Melanoma
diseases.description: A type of skin cancer that begins in melanocytes.
symptoms: Development of a new pigmented or unusual-looking growth on the skin
Change in the surface of a mole (e.g., scaling, oozing, bleeding)
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, PET scan)

diseases.name: Basal Cell Carcinoma
diseases.description: A type of skin cancer that begins in the basal cells of the skin.
symptoms: Flat, flesh-colored or brown scar-like lesion
Bleeding or scabbing sore that heals and returns

diseases.name: Squamous Cell Carcinoma
diseases.description: A type of skin cancer that begins in the squamous cells of the skin.
symptoms: Open sore that bleeds or crusts
Raised growth with a central depression

diseases.name: Lung Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the cells of the lungs.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT scan, MRI, PET scan)

diseases.name: Brain Tumor
diseases.description: An abnormal growth of cells in the brain.

diseases.name: Osteoporosis
diseases.description: A condition in which the bones become weak and brittle.
treatment: Medications (e.g., bisphosphonates, hormone replacement therapy, teriparatide)

diseases.name: Fibromyalgia
diseases.description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, memory and mood issues.
symptoms: Numbness or tingling in hands and feet
treatment: Medications (e.g., pain relievers, antidepressants, anti-seizure drugs)

diseases.name: Ankylosing Spondylitis
diseases.description: A type of arthritis that affects the spine, causing inflammation of the spinal joints.
symptoms: Loss of flexibility in the spine

diseases.name: Sjogren's Syndrome
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease that affects the glands that make tears and saliva.
treatment: Medications (e.g., artificial tears, saliva substitutes, immunosuppressants)

diseases.name: Scleroderma
diseases.description: A group of rare diseases that involve the hardening and tightening of the skin and connective tissues.

diseases.name: Vasculitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the blood vessels.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., angiography, CT scan, MRI)

diseases.name: Polymyalgia Rheumatica
diseases.description: An inflammatory disorder that causes muscle pain and stiffness, often in the shoulders.
symptoms: Pain and stiffness in the shoulders, neck, and hips
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., erythrocyte sedimentation rate, C-reactive protein)

diseases.name: Giant Cell Arteritis
diseases.description: An inflammatory disease that affects the large and medium arteries, often involving the temporal arteries.
diagnosis: Blood tests (e.g., erythrocyte sedimentation rate, C-reactive protein)

diseases.name: Behcet's Disease
diseases.description: A rare disorder that causes inflammation in blood vessels throughout the body.

diseases.name: Raynaud's Disease
diseases.description: A condition that causes some areas of your body, such as fingers and toes, to feel numb and cold in response to cold temperatures or stress.
treatment: Medications (e.g., calcium channel blockers, alpha blockers)

diseases.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diseases.description: A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves.

diseases.name: Parkinson's Disease
diseases.description: A progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement.
treatment: Medications (e.g., levodopa, dopamine agonists, MAO-B inhibitors)

diseases.name: Huntington's Disease
diseases.description: A progressive brain disorder that causes uncontrolled movements, emotional problems, and loss of thinking ability.
complications: Progressive decline in cognitive and physical abilities

diseases.name: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
diseases.description: A progressive neurodegenerative disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.

diseases.name: Epilepsy
diseases.description: A central nervous system disorder in which nerve cell activity in the brain becomes disrupted, leading to seizures.

diseases.name: Migraine
diseases.description: A neurological condition that can cause multiple symptoms, characterized by intense, debilitating headaches.
symptoms: Throbbing pain on one side of the head
treatment: Medications (e.g., pain relievers, triptans, ergot alkaloids, anti-nausea drugs)

diseases.name: Heart Failure
diseases.description: A chronic condition in which the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs, ankles, or feet
Increased need to urinate at night
treatment: Medications (e.g., ACE inhibitors, beta-blockers, diuretics, aldosterone antagonists)

diseases.name: Coronary Artery Disease
diseases.description: A condition in which plaque builds up inside the coronary arteries, which supply oxygen-rich blood to the heart muscle.
treatment: Lifestyle changes (e.g., diet, exercise, smoking cessation)
Medications (e.g., statins, beta-blockers, nitrates, calcium channel blockers)
Procedures (e.g., angioplasty, stent placement, coronary artery bypass surgery)

diseases.name: Arrhythmia
diseases.description: A problem with the rate or rhythm of the heartbeat.
treatment: Medications (e.g., antiarrhythmic drugs, beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers)
Procedures (e.g., cardioversion, catheter ablation, implantable cardioverter-defibrillator)

diseases.name: Pericarditis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the pericardium, the sac-like covering around the heart.

diseases.name: Endocarditis
diseases.description: An infection of the inner lining of the heart chambers and heart valves.
symptoms: Swelling in the legs or abdomen

diseases.name: Myocarditis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the heart muscle.

diseases.name: Pulmonary Embolism
diseases.description: A blockage in one of the pulmonary arteries in the lungs.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., CT pulmonary angiogram, V/Q scan)

diseases.name: Pulmonary Fibrosis
diseases.description: A lung disease that occurs when lung tissue becomes damaged and scarred.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., chest X-ray, CT scan)

diseases.name: Cystic Fibrosis
diseases.description: An inherited disorder that causes severe damage to the lungs and digestive system.
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., chest X-ray, CT scan)

diseases.name: Sleep Apnea
diseases.description: A serious sleep disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts.
symptoms: Episodes of stopped breathing during sleep

diseases.name: Influenza
diseases.description: A viral infection that attacks the respiratory system.

diseases.name: Pneumothorax
diseases.description: A collapsed lung, which occurs when air leaks into the space between the lung and chest wall.

diseases.name: Pleural Effusion
diseases.description: Excess fluid that accumulates in the pleural cavity, the fluid-filled space that surrounds the lungs.

diseases.name: Pulmonary Hypertension
diseases.description: A type of high blood pressure that affects the arteries in the lungs and the right side of the heart.
symptoms: Swelling in the ankles or legs
diagnosis: Imaging studies (e.g., chest X-ray, CT scan)
treatment: Medications (e.g., vasodilators, endothelin receptor antagonists, phosphodiesterase-5 inhibitors)

diseases.name: Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)
diseases.description: A serious lung condition caused by injury to the tiny air sacs in the lungs.
